Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Jar
Description: Small oval-shaped jar with a wide restricted mouth and a flat base of small diametre. The walls of the vessel are thin and end in a simple lip, which is emphasised by an incised horizontal line on the exterior. The vessel is brown in colour but bears a few black patches due to firing conditions. The interior surface was more carefully polished than the exterior, which bears thin diagonal striations.
